alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 17 at 6:21AM CDT until August 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Warren County in west central Illinois... Southeastern Mercer County in northwestern Illinois... Southern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 621 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near North Henderson, or 13 miles east of Aledo, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Woodhull and Alpha around 630 AM CDT. Nekoma around 640 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Bishop Hill, Galva and Kewanee Municipal Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
